sentence.idiomatic: He bought a lot of calligraphy art, but he doesn’t quite know how to appreciate them.
I really admire her way of life.
Are you looking at the paintings by Leonardo Da Vinci?
While you're in Hainan, you must enjoy the sunshine.
You have to be able to enjoy life besides making money.
Have you come to Shanghai for the scenery?
His hand writing is neat and fluid.
This sketch has flowing lines. It must be a master’s work.
This writer has a flowing writing style. He has an outstanding talent.
Men in skirts are always weird to me.
His handwriting is outside the box. It looks strange.
Although she is arrogant, but we don't have any problems getting along with her.
When u first start learning to write the characters, you have to imitate the writing in calligraphy books.
Your writing will improve as you imitate the style of master calligraphers.
He didn’t copy this painting.
I heard that you like to paint. So I bought these brushes just for you.
Is this calligraphy copy book specially prepared for me?
Copying the style in calligraphy copy books is not the only thing we do. It’s just our hobby.
Teacher, please take a look at the characters I wrote this time.
Um, I can see you’ve put in a lot of effort. Your writing is continuously improving.
Thank you. I’ve bought all the script books you recommended. It’s a joy to appreciate the writing of these great masters of calligraphy.

Yes indeed. I feel that you now have a general grasp of calligraphy. Your writing is neat and elegant, but still lack of the flowing quality. Your handling and composition of characters also needs improvement.
This is what I am troubled by. I also intentionally bought the ‘four treasures of the study’ to practice. But my horizontal strokes and right strokes still look awkward.
Don’t worry. As long as you pay more attention to how you hold the brush and copy more script books, you will write better and better.

word.literal: the tip of a writing brush
